Moten himself was a pianist, but the band so influenced Basie that he was determined to get a position as staff arranger & substitute pianist. https://t.co/wr9HzqW5yB

Although just a teenager, Basie was touring as a pianist and accompanist on the major vaudeville circuits. It’s believed that his experience in these roles ultimately lead to Basie’s reputation as a bandleader who had no issues with younger musicians taking up the spotlight. https://t.co/MVY8sqpBNt
The soldier waved back at the Pianist through she stayed quiet during her interaction with the Pianist. It looks like she's ready for her to play another song! https://t.co/VyAzZFiXmG

On one afternoon the Palace’s house pianist failed to show for work, Basie offered to fill in but was denied. But being persistent, the young Basie waited for the film to start, crept into the orchestra pit, and accompanied the film. https://t.co/VFrfo2S4CB

Although I've seen parts of it over the yrs, today I watched "The Best Years of Our Lives" in full--& cried at different points. Dana Andrews, Frederick March & Harold Russell were 5-star stars as returning vets & Hoagy Carmichael was great pianist & actor.
The soldier would look stare at the Pianist's playing. Her notes were as melodious as ever. https://t.co/6z3bUDULFm
